Description: Humans are probably the most versatile of races, and that comes with its own advantages and disadvantages.

~Proficiency in Persuasion~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for persuading people non-agressively (convincing them through dialogue).

~Proficiency in General Knowledge~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for knowing various simple facts about science, astronomy, trades, etc.

Language: You speak Common and a number of languages of choice equal to your Intelligence.

~Human Vigilence~.Effect: Whenever you make a Check (before the roll), instead of rolling, you can automatically take the number 5 for the die (as if you rolled 5) for that Check.

~Talented~.Effect: You start with Training in any 2 Weapon Categories or Proficiencies (or one of each).
~Talented~.Notes: Weapon Categories are 1-Handed Melee Weapons, Shields, 2-Handed Ranged Weapons, etc.

~Human Diversity~.Effect:
Choose any other Race except Dragonborn and Davel.
Gain one of its Racial Feats.
~Human Diversity~.Notes: Go to that Race's page and look for its Racial Feats list. You can't pick one that upgrades an Ability you don't have.

Starting Abilities Description.Humans:
Humans are among the most consistent of the races and their concentration and mental resilience make them able to constantly succeed at menial tasks.
Human Vigilence also works for Resist Checks. But use it carefully - if you don't match the Spell Grade, you will fail automatically if you choose to take 4 instead of rolling!

Starting Abilities Description.Human Diversity:
There are several interesting starting Abilities you can choose from as a Human.
You can make yourself immune to Slows through the Bertle Ability, get more Reserve Health from Dwarves, a Spell from Elves.
You could see in the dark like the Gnomes, detect living creatures like the Hollows or use Might instead of Dexterity with any weapon!

Starting Abilities Description.Talented:
Humans start with Training in any 2 Weapon Categories (1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Melee, 1-Handed Ranged, 2-Handed Ranged and Shields).
Check the Weapons page to see all the weapon categories!

~Social Talent~.Effect: Your Charisma increases by +1 (up to +3), your Charisma Resist Checks by an extra +1 and you can understand the intent, tonality or general idea of written texts and spoken phrases in any language you don't speak.

~Magic Diversity~.Effect: Pick either Arcane, Eldritch or Divine, and you can also Know Abilities from that Ability List, on top of the Ability Lists from your Class.

~Ignorance Bliss~.Effect:
When you would use Main Stat for an Ability, you can use the number 3 instead.
Your Spell Grade is at least 9 (as if your Main Stat were 3).
You gain Proficiency in Luck.
~Ignorance Bliss~.Notes: For example, Magic Missiles shoots out a number of missiles equal to your Main Stat. So, with Ignorance Bliss, you can just replace Main Stat with the number 3.
